discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Event processing: Best practices
1. For large network environment
- Enable multi-node processing (event_processor_enable_multi_node is Yes)
- Increase the number of scheduled jobs processing events to 4 (event_processor_job_count)

2. Latency issues when receiving events
- Verify that the bucket field in the event (em_event) table is set to a value greater than zero (0)

choices.D: Increase the number of scheduled jobs processing events
choices.C: Ensure the bucket value in the event table is greater than 0

questions.question_text: Which two methods can be used to improve the processing of events in large network environments? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Discovered application services from Service Mapping

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct one

Selected Answer: D
On the Operator Workspace, you can view alerts by application services (Discovered or Manual application service),
technical service, and alert group. For services, you can also open a
service map to view relationships between CIs in the service.

Selected Answer: D
Correlation group is no service.

questions.question_text: If events are not matching to alerts as you would like, what field should be changed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text: If the Message Key is not populated, the default value is created from which fields?

choices.E: Source, type. node, resource, and time of event
choices.D: Source, source instance, node, and type
choices.A: Source, type. node, resource, and metric name
choices.B: Source, source instance, node, and resource
choices.C: Source, type. node, and metric name

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the correct one. Repeated question in previous page.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/concept/c_EMEventIdentifier.html
A. Source, type. node, resource, and metric name
